column1: Janet's duck produces 16 eggs a day. Janet consumes three eggs every morning as part of her breakfast, uses four of them daily to bake muffins for her friends, and sells the rest at the market for $2 each. How much does she get in the market every day?
To make a robe, you need two volumes of blue fibers and half of white fibers. How many volumes do you need in total?
Josh decided to try his hand at real estate. He bought the house for $80,000 and spent $50,000 to fix it up. As a result, the price of the house went up 150 percent.
So, James decided to run three sprints three times a week, three sprints each time.

Every day, Wendy gives her chickens three cups of a mixture of seeds, mealworms and vegetables to maintain their health. She divides the chickens' feed into three feeds. She gives 15 cups of feed to the whole chicken in the morning, 25 more cups in the afternoon. If Wendy had a total of 20 chickens, how many cups would she need to give her chickens for the third feeding?

Kyler went to the store to buy glass for his new apartment. The glass costs five dollars each, but if you buy one, you can buy the second one for 60 percent of the original price. Kyler is going to buy 16 glasses. How much would it cost?
Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston, and Charleston has four times as many sheep as Seattle. If Seattle had 20 sheep, how many sheep would Toulouse, Charleston, and Seattle have in total?

So, if you're trying to download a file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file, and you're trying to download a 200-gigabyte file.

John drives back after three hours at 60 miles per hour, realizing that he has left something very important at home. He tries to get home within four hours, but the first two hours are stuck in heavy traffic. He drives for the next 30 minutes at 30 miles per hour, and then he drives home at 80 miles per hour. At the time of the four hours, how many miles is John away from home?
Eliza's hourly wage, for the first 40 hours of the week, is $10 and overtime is paid 1.2 times the normal wage. If Eliza worked 45 hours this week, what would be the salary she would get?
The first month, the new program was downloaded 60 times. The second month, the number of downloads tripled, and the third month, it was down 30 percent.
Toura went to the bakery and bought a variety of pastries: 36 doughnuts for $68, 12 mini cupcakes for $80, 24 mini cupcakes for $80, and 72 mini cheesecakes for $55 each. What was the total amount?

Carlos is going to plant a lemon tree. It costs $90 to plant a lemon tree. It costs $1.5 to grow seven lemons a year. It costs $3 a year to water and fertilize a tree. How many years will it take Carlos to start making a profit from a lemon tree?

Melanie is a visiting salesperson, and she sold one-third of the vacuum cleaners in the green house, two in the red house, and half of the rest in the orange house. If Melanie has five vacuum cleaners left, how many did she have when she started selling them?

In a dance class of 20 students, 20 percent of the students are studying contemporary dance, 25 percent of the rest are studying jazz dance, and the rest are studying hip hop dance. What is the percentage of the students who are studying hip hop dance?

A merchant is trying to choose between two finishing plans, a $5,000 jewel and an $8,000 electronics product. According to the merchant's financial advisor, the price of jewelry will rise by 2.5% and the price of electronics by 1.2% over the next month. If you choose a finishing plan to maximize your profits at the end of the month, what will be your profit?

Two trains depart San Rafael at the same time. Each one travels 80 miles in a westward direction. The next day, they travel 150 miles in a northward direction. How many miles did each train travel in two days?

Jill, as a teacher, gets paid $20 an hour, and as a childcare coach, she gets paid $30 an hour. If Jill works 50 weeks a year, 35 hours a week as a teacher, and 15 hours a week as a coach, what is her annual salary?
Claire makes three egg-based omelets for breakfast every morning. How many eggs will Claire eat in four weeks?

Marissa hikes for 12 miles. It takes her an hour to walk the first four miles, and another hour to walk the next two. If she wants to walk at an average speed of four miles per hour, how fast should she walk the rest of the distance?

I have 10 liters of orange juice, two-thirds of which is water. I'm going to add this to a 15 liters of pineapple drink, three-fifths of which is water. I spilled a liter of orange juice on the way there.
Raymond and Samantha are brothers. Raymond was born six years before Samantha. Raymond had a son when he was 23 years old. If Samantha is now 31, how many years ago was Raymond's son born?
Billy sells DVDs. He has eight customers on Tuesday. His first three customers each buy one DVD. His next two customers each buy two DVDs. His last three customers don't buy DVDs.
A candle that burns for one hour melts by two centimeters. How many centimeters would a candle that burns between 1 p.m. and 5 p.m. shorten?
Kyle bought a bestseller last year for $19.50, 25% off the original price. How much was the original price of this book?

Mary asked for a $12 chicken menu, five packs of milk for $3 each, four apples for $1.50 each, and several boxes of pizza. Mary paid $50 for all of them. If a box of pizza was $8.50, how many boxes of pizza did Mary ask for?

Mishka bought three half-pants, three long-pants, and three pairs of shoes. Half-pants were $16.50 each, long-pants were $22.50 each, and shoes were $42 each. How much did you spend on all the clothes?
Cynthia eats one serving of ice cream every night. She bought a carton of 15 servings of ice cream for $4 a carton. How much ice cream will she be spending in 60 days?
Henry stops at two places on a 60-mile bike ride. He first stopped after 20 miles. The second stop was 15 miles from the end of the trip. How many miles are there between the first and second stop?

Gloria came to buy shoes and found a pair that fits her budget. But she has to choose between the boots and the two-foot high heels, which are five dollars cheaper than the boots combined. If one of the heels costs $33 and the other one costs twice as much, how much are the boots?
The ratio of Darrell's and Allen's ages is 7:11. If their ages add up to 162 now, what will Allen's age be in 10 years?

Gunter is trying to count the bottles of jelly beans. He asks his friend how many he thinks are in the bottles. One person says 80, another says 20 more than half of the first person's answer, and a third person says 25 more than the first person's answer. What is the average of the three people's estimates?
John takes care of ten dogs, each of which requires 30 minutes of walking and caring a day. How many hours a week does he take care of the dogs?
Gretchen has 110 coins. There are 30 more gold coins than silver coins. How many gold coins does Gretchen have?
Aaron has five more jewels than Raymond. If Raymond has 40 jewels, how many jewels does Siobhan have?
Mike plays 40 minutes of table tennis. In the first 20 minutes, he scores four points. In the next 20 minutes, he scores 25 percent more.
Terry eats two yogurts a day. Now there are four yogurts for $5. How much does he spend on yogurt for 30 days?
John is going to sell all of his toys and use the money to buy video games. He has 13 Lego sets, and he sells them for $15 each. He ended up buying eight $20 video games, and he's left with $5.
John runs 60 miles a week. He runs three days a week. The first day he runs three hours, and the other two days he runs half. How fast does he run?

Dana can run four times as fast as she can walk, but she can skip at half the speed she runs. If she can skip at three miles an hour, run a third of the time, and walk two thirds, how many miles will she go in six hours?
So, if you're using an iPhone that's four times older than Ben's iPhone, and Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Susie's iPhone, then if Susie's iPhone is one year old, what year is Brandon's iPhone?

The great dragon Perg sat on the top of Mount Farbo and set fire to everything within 1,000 feet. Polly was able to throw a golden spear, known as the only weapon to cut the dragon, 400 feet, a distance that was enough for the dragon's flame to reach. However, if Polly had the sapphire jewel, he could throw the spear three times farther than if he did not. If he had the jewel, how far away from the dragon's flame could Polly throw the golden spear at the dragon?

Grandma Jones baked five apple pies for the firemen's luncheon. She cut each pie into eight pieces, and placed the five pies on the buffet table so that guests could take them for themselves. After the guests took each pie and ate it, there were 14 pies left over at the end of the night. How many pies did the guests eat?

According to the nutrition facts, a bag of potato chips has 250 calories per serving. If your daily calorie target is 2,000, and you're already eating 1,800 calories, how many grams of potato chips can you eat in a bag of five servings?

Charlie wants to sell a honeycomb. For every pound of honeycomb, he can make 10 tapered candles. For every pound of spare honeycomb and core, it costs $10. If he sells each candle for $2.00, what would be the net profit if he made and sold 20 candles?

Meredith is a freelance blogger who writes about health topics and submits them to clients every day. It takes an average of four hours to research and write a blog post. Last week, on Monday, she wrote five articles, on Tuesday she wrote two-fifths as many articles as on Monday.

Candice put 80 Post-its in her bag before she left for work at the coffee shop. On the way, she stopped at the store and bought a pack of Post-its. At work, she put one Post-it note on each of 220 different coffee cups. If she had 23 Post-it notes left, how many Post-its were in the pack she bought?
John buys twice as many red ties as blue ties. Red ties are 50% more expensive than blue ties. He spent $200 on blue ties that cost $40 each. How many ties did he spend?
Tracy used a 4-foot wire to support the tomato seedlings in the garden, and the wire is now cut into 6-inch lengths.
Richard lives in a 15-story apartment. Each floor has eight rooms, three-quarters of the building occupied. How many rooms are there in the building that are unoccupied?
Lloyd owns an egg farm. His chickens produce 252 eggs a day and sell them for $2 a dozen. How many eggs can Lloyd produce in a week?
Tom's boat can go 10 miles an hour. He sails from 1 to 4 p.m. Then he'll be on his way home at 6 miles an hour. How long will it take him to get back?

Uriah's bookshelf is too heavy for him. He needs to remove it from the 15-pound bottom. His comic books are each 1/4 pound, his toys are each 1/2 pound. If he removes 30 comic books, how many toys does he need to remove?

The mechanic charges different rates for repairing trucks and cars. The mechanic charges $60 for repairing the tires of each truck, and the mechanic charges $40 for repairing the tires of each car. On Thursday, the mechanic repairs the tires of six trucks and four cars. On Friday, the mechanic repairs 12 tires, but does not repair the tires of the truck. On the day the mechanic made more profit, how much profit did he make?

Sister Doubtfire is driving home with seven kittens she took from a local shelter when her mother calls to tell them that two of her cats have given birth to kittens. She says that the first cat, Patchy, gave birth to three times as many kittens as she had, and another cat, Trixie, gave birth to 12 kittens. How many kittens do the Doubtfire family have now?
Jane has 30 chickens. Jane eats two of them. With the rest of the chickens, Jane wants to put two chickens in one bag and set them up. How many bags can Jane have?
Peter is going to the movies this week. He always buys $7 tickets and $7 popcorn. If he has $42 for the week, how many times can he go to the movies?

A wooden bridge cannot withstand a weight of more than 5,000 pounds. A delivery truck is carrying 33 identical boxes, each 15 pounds, as it attempts to cross the bridge. The combined weight of the driver and the empty truck is 3,755 pounds. Without exceeding the weight limit of the bridge, how many boxes can be loaded onto the truck?

Stephen ordered groceries online. His final bill was $40.00. He went through the delivery company, so they added a 25% commission to the final total and charged him $3.00 for the delivery fee. Stephen also added a $4.00 tip. After adding the additional commission, what was the final fee for Steven's grocery order?
The raspberry bush has six rows of 20 seeds each and 67 seeds independently. How many raspberries are there in all?
In the bowl, there are 25 oranges, one is dead, 20 percent is still blue, two are sour, and the rest are in good condition. How many oranges are in good condition?
Janet buys her daughter a brooch. She paid $500 for the materials to make it, and then $800 to have a jeweler make it. Then she insured it for 10%.
If Marcy works for the same company for 40 years, she gets $50,000 a year. After 20 years, she gets 5% of the annual pension. If she quits after 30 years, what is her pension?

If Arena subscribes to a streaming service that costs $140 per month, then if she pays for the first half of the year and the streaming service offers her the next half at a 10% discount, then calculate the fee she paid for the streaming service by the end of the year.

Sophia is thinking about taking a road trip and wants to know how far she can go with one tank of gas. She has driven 100 miles since she last filled up and needed to put in four gallons to fill up again. The owner's manual says that the tank has 12 gallons of gas. How many miles can Sophia go with one tank of gas?
Jim spends two hours watching TV, and then he goes to bed and reads for half that time. He does this three times a week. In four weeks, how many hours does he spend watching TV and reading?

In a basketball tournament, four schools compete. Each school has a girls' basketball team and a boys' basketball team, each team has five players. Each school also has a coach. How many people in all schools participate?
A treasure hunter found a buried treasure trove filled with jewels, 175 diamonds, and 35 fewer rubies, twice as many emeralds. How many jewels were in the trove altogether?
Dr. Wells' school has twice as many boys as girls. If there are 60 girls and one teacher for every five students, how many teachers are there?
So, if you have a little bit of money, you have a little bit of money, and then you have eight weeks of five dollars a week.
Judy teaches five dance classes a day on weekdays, eight classes on Saturdays. If you have 15 students in each class, and you charge $15 per class, how much does she make in a week?

Kerian has two recipes for preparing a dish, the first with 20 instructions, the second with twice as many instructions as the first. How many instructions does Kerian have to read in order to prepare two dishes?
Tommy is selling a $3 brownie and a $4 cheesecake for his charity. If Tommy sells 43 brownies and 23 cheesecakes, how much does Tommy get?
Sheela bought five cell phones for three payments of $150 each. Each unit is charged at 2% interest. How much will Sheela pay each month for three months?

Artie has a flower stand at the Farmers Market. He sells three types of flowers: marigold, petunia, and begonia. Marigold is $2.74 a bowl, petunia is $1.87 a bowl, and begonia is $2.12 a bowl. Since Artie doesn't have any fish today, he decided to price everything in the nearest dollar unit. If Artie sells 12 bowl of marigold, 9 bowl of petunia, and 17 bowl of begonia, how much can he sell?

Luke spends time building sandcastles on the beach. He eventually realizes that each layer of sand castles is half the size of the one below. If he builds a four-tiered sand castle, and the top layer is 16 square feet, what is the average size of each layer?

Cecilia has just bought a new puppy. According to her veterinarian, she must give her puppy one cup of dog food every day for the first 180 days. Then, for the rest of her life, she must give her puppy two cups of dog food. If there are 110 cups in a bag of dog food, how many bags of dog food does Cecilia have for the first year?

If Raymond does half as much laundry as Sarah does, and Sarah does as much laundry as David does, and Sarah does 400 pounds of laundry, how much difference is there between Raymond and David's laundry?
So, if you buy three flowers for $2.50 or two flowers for $1 at a lower price, how much would you get if you bought 18 flowers?
John adopts the dog. He takes the dog to the groomer, and it costs $100. The groomer offers him a 30% discount for new customers.
Two girls each drank one sixth of 24 liters of water. Then the boy drank 6 liters of water. How many liters of water are left?
Charlie has 10 stamps. He bought 21 stamps at the mall store, and he got 23 stamps for his birthday. Then Charlie gave nine of them to his sister, and he used 28 of them for greeting cards.
Grace weighs 125 pounds. Alex weighs two pounds lighter than four times Grace's weight. How many pounds do they weigh together?
Dan plants three rose seedlings. Each rose seedling has 25 roses. Each rose has eight petals. How many petals are there in all?
The football team played 22 games. They won eight more games than they lost. How many times did they win?
Gene sews a skirt from a gift T-shirt. He gets a shirt every time he goes on vacation. Each shirt is a different skirt block. Each row is made of blocks from different years of vacation.

Greg has set the alarm to go off three times a day as a reminder. It will go off until Greg turns it off. The first time it went off today, it went off four times. The second time it went off three times as long as the first time. The third time it went off half as long as the second time.

A company pays its employees $600 a month, and has a policy of increasing the salaries of employees who have been with the company for five years by 10% of their starting salary every year. If Sylvie celebrated her fifth year of employment last December, what would her annual salary be after three more years?
And the first record of Marilyn sold ten times as many as Harald's. If they sold 88,000 copies, how many did Harald sell?

Christina is planning a birthday party, and since one-quarter of the attendees won't attend, she needs 75 gift bags for each guest. She has invited 16 friends. The gift bags are $2 each. How much will she spend?

Ted from Tyrannosaurus was planning to bring potato salad to a dinosaur picnic, and he found that an adult dinosaur eats 10 pounds of potato salad, and a child eats half of an adult. If Ted wants everyone to have enough to eat, if 20 adults and five children are going on a picnic, how many pounds of potato salad do we need to bring to the picnic?
Jan has three times as many pets as Marcia. Marcia has two more pets than Cindy. If Cindy has four pets, how many pets do they all have?

Emily has four children named Amy, Jackson, Collie, and James. Amy is five years older than Jackson, and Collie is two years younger. If James is ten years old and Collie is one year younger, how old is Jackson?

Lee used to run the 400 meter hurdles two seconds faster than Gerald ran the 400 meter hurdles. But Gerald changed his diet and his speed improved by ten percent. If Lee can run the 400 meter hurdles in 38 seconds, how many seconds can Gerald run the 400 meter hurdles with his diet improved?
In a neighborhood, there are 12 fewer pet rabbits than there are pet dogs and cats combined. If there are two cats for every dog, and 60 dogs, how many pets are there in the neighborhood?
Out of 200 fifth graders, two-fifths of them are boys, two-thirds of them are girls in Girl Scouts. How many girls are not in Girl Scouts?
Harry slept nine hours last night. His friend James slept only two-thirds as much as Harry. How many more hours did Harry sleep than James?

When Frida makes a sauce from a can of tomatoes, the volume is halved. Each 16-ounce can of tomatoes she uses contains three tomatoes. The last batch of tomato sauce contained 32 ounces. How many tomatoes did Frida use?

Cars are lined up on the highway. Some of them run the first 15 minutes of the traffic jam, and the next 20 run the remaining 15 minutes of the traffic jam. Of the line, five cars left the exit so they wouldn't have to run into the traffic jam. If originally 30 cars were on the highway, how many cars ran the first 15 minutes of the traffic jam?

Marie is an avid performer. Yesterday, she received 18 new potted plants from her favorite nursery. She already owns two potted plants in each of the 40 window frames of her spacious country house. She has grown up and decided that she will give one potted plant from each window frame to her friends and family tomorrow. How many potted plants does Marie have left?

Jerome has four friends who come to visit him on a certain day. The first friend rang the bell 20 times before Jerome opened the door, the second friend rang the bell a quarter of the time. The third friend rang the bell 10 times more than the fourth friend. If the fourth friend rang the bell 60 times, how many times did the bell ring?

Solo has to read four pages of a science textbook, 20 pages of a sociology textbook, seven pages of a history textbook, and eight pages of a geography textbook. Solo read 15 pages on Monday. If he has four days left before he finishes reading, how many pages does he need to read on average in a day?

John likes to drink a glass of water at breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Eventually, he drinks one before going to bed. John does this every day during the week, but he wants to relax on the weekends, so he drinks soda instead at dinner. How many times a week does he drink water?

A fog bank coming from the sea covers the city. It takes 10 minutes to cover three miles of the city. If the city is 42 miles from the sea to the other end of the land, how many minutes does it take for the fog to cover the entire city?
Poppy is solving a jigsaw puzzle of 1,000 pieces. She puts a quarter of the pieces on the board, and her mother ties the remaining third. How many puzzle pieces remain untied?
Cody eats three times as many cookies as Amir. If Amir eats five cookies, how many cookies will they both eat?
John has three boxes. Each box is 5 inches by 6 inches by 4 inches. The wall is 1 inch of heat. What is the total volume of the three boxes?

Frankie watches TV every night after he finishes his homework. On Monday and Tuesday, he watched an hour episode of his favorite show each day. On Wednesday, he watched several half-hour episodes. On Thursday, he finished his homework early and watched an hour and a half episode. On Friday, he stayed up late and watched two one-hour episodes. If he watched seven hours of television in total, how many half-hour episodes did he watch on Wednesday?

Henry is making cookies for a local contest. He wants to bake twice as many as he did last year. When he finishes, he realizes that he is actually baking 15 more than he thought. He takes out the cookies to cool them, removes five of them, and now has a total of 110 cookies.

The local gas station is selling it for $3.00 a gallon. The app company will give you a cashback of $0.20 per gallon if you fill up at this gas station. If someone buys 10 gallons of gasoline, what will the gas bill be after the cashback?

Marcel and Beatrice were competing to see who could eat the most fruit rolls, and they distributed as many as they could find. Unfortunately, someone was wrong, Beatrice's was two rolls wide and 24 rolls long, while Marcel's was three rolls wide and 14 rolls long. And when they had eaten all of them, how much did they eat on average?

Julia's boat leaked while driving on the lake. The boat was leaking two liters of water every time she went 10 feet to shore. The shore was 64 seconds ahead. How much water did Julia have in the boat by the time she reached the shore?

In a classroom, there is a whiteboard that is shared by four teachers who take turns using the classroom. Each teacher has two classes a day, and they use the whiteboard in each class. If the whiteboard is cleaned three times in one class, how many times a day is the whiteboard cleaned?
Ryan plants two flowers in his garden a day. After 15 days, if five flowers have not grown, how many flowers does he have?

Jamar's phone can store six times as many photos as Brittany's phone. The maximum number of photos Brittany's phone can store is 50 times the number of birds in the photos of Jamar's ducks in the zoo. If Jamar's phone can store 1800 photos, how many ducks are in the photos of Jamar's ducks in the zoo?

Sasha noticed that the price of the wood had gone up by 50% in the months since she had bought some. She had some left over, so she decided to sell them. She had 10 boards of 2 x 4 x 10 that cost $10 each.
Katie makes coffee, a few cups of sugar and a few cups of hot water in the ratio of 7:13. If you use a total of 120 cups of sugar and water, calculate how many cups of sugar she used.
John buys two pairs of shoes for each of his three children. Each costs $60. How much did he pay?

The customs officer at the main port on the coast is checking two containers of imported cars, each containing five cars. The next day, more containers are being transported, bringing the total number of vehicles in the port to 30. Assuming that all containers contain five cars, calculate how many containers were imported on the second day.
Adrian's total salary is 30% higher than Lillian's salary. After four years, his salary has increased, and he has 40% more income than four years ago.
Miguel, he uses two pads of paper a week for his paintings. If there are 30 pads in one pad, how many pads does he use every month?

Morissette and Kyle were asked to bring fruit. Morissette brought five apples and eight oranges, while Kyle brought twice as many apples and half as many oranges. How many fruits do they have in total?

Sadie slept eight hours on Monday. The next two days, she had to finish her homework, and she slept two hours less each. If she slept one hour more than the rest of the week, on those two days, how many hours did she sleep in the whole week?
Rosie runs for three hours at 10 miles per hour. Then she runs at 5 miles per hour. How many miles can she run in seven hours?

Jenny is helping in her mother's office. She has a pile of 60 letters that need stamping and a pile of letters that have already been stamped. She stamps one-third of the letters that need stamping. If there are now 30 letters in the pile of letters that have already been stamped, how many letters were there in the pile when Jenny started working?

Julia was going to eat the stew and prepare for a dinner party at home. She realized that there were not enough plastic spoons, so she bought a new pack of spoons. Later, her husband also bought five new packets of spoons and gave them to Julia. Julia used three spoons to taste the stew while making the stew. Later, when she went to set the table, there were 12 spoons in all. How many were in the pack of spoons that Julia bought?

Dylan needed chicken sausage and fish sausage in the grocery store to make the sausage bag. He bought 38 chicken sausages and six more fish sausages than there were chicken sausages. How many sausages did Dylan buy in all?
Since moving to a new school, Amy has made 20 more friends than Lily. If Lily has 50 friends, how many friends have Lily and Abby made together?

Well's mother sells willow, millet, and oranges at the local store. The willow is three times the price of each millet. The orange is five times cheaper than the willow. Dillon sent four willows, 20 millet, and 10 oranges to the store. If a millet costs $15, how much is it?

A hospital sees 500 patients a day. Each patient is seen for an average of 24 minutes. The doctor charges the hospital $150 an hour. The hospital charges the patient $200 an hour. How much revenue does the hospital make from these visits?

Nisa hires 60 temporary employees to play elves in her department store in Santa Village. One-third of the elves quit after their children spit on them. Then the other ten quit after their children kick their snouts. How many elves are left?
Joseph's expenditure in May was $500. In June, his expenditure was $60 less. What was the total of his expenditure in these two months?

Pam and Fred went to the carnival. Pam took the jet coaster twice, Fred took four. Then they each took the Ridge twice. If each of them used six tickets to ride, how many tickets did they use that day?

On Monday, Walt walked four miles. On Tuesday, he walked six times the number of miles he walked on Monday. He walked a total of 41 miles from Monday to Wednesday. On Wednesday, how many miles did he walk?
Tom washes four cars a month. If each car costs $15 to wash, how much would you pay in a year?
Brian's friend Bobby has five fewer games than Brian has three times as many games. If Brian has 20 video games and lost five just before the comparison, how many games does Bobby have?
There are 27 unicorns left in the world, and a third of them are in the Scottish Highlands. Two-thirds of the Scottish unicorns are female. How many female Scottish unicorns are there?

Laurie ordered two $7.50 sandwiches, two $1.50 bags of potato chips, and two $1.00 cookies to be delivered. The accounting adds 20% to the delivery fee, and she wants to pay $5.00 in a tip. How much is the delivery order?

Mark took a 75-question test yesterday. He finished the test at the rate of solving five questions in an hour. Today, he took a 100-question test at the same rate. If Mark took eight hours to finish the first test and six hours to finish the next test, how many problems did he not solve?
In a candy machine, there are four times as many pink gum balls as there are blue gum balls.
Of the 20 cars available for rent, 12 are automatic, four are manual, and the rest are semi-automatic. What is the percentage of semi-automatic?
There are 700 bees in a hive, 12 times the baby bowl, there are worker bees, there are twice as many baby bees as there are queen bees.
Jordan plays video games for two hours a day. He also has a part-time job that pays him $10 an hour. If he were to work part-time instead of playing video games, how much would Jordan make in a week?
John buys milk for $2, eggs for $3, light bulbs for $3, cups for $3, and cockroach traps for $4. If all but food is taxed at 10%, how much is it?

Kim started a home improvement business and calculated how much profit he could make from his customers. He already has three customers, but he's in negotiations with five other potential customers, and he's confident enough to include them in the calculation. Each customer's home requires two bottles of bleach and a pack of cloth to clean.
John has a pineapple farm of 10 hectares. There are 100 pineapples per hectare. John can harvest pineapples every three months. How many pineapples can John harvest in a year?

Johnny is picking up his toys from the floor of his room. He's turned over boxes of 500 Legos on the floor, boxes of three times the number of 500 Legos, boxes of one-quarter of the number of Legos. If he picked up all the Legos, how many blocks would he pick up in total?

Deborah, who monitors the hive, sees how many bees are coming in and out of the hive in a day. In the first six hours, she sees 30 bees leave the hive, and half of them come back in six hours. She sees twice as many bees as the first one leave the hive, fly out of the hive and leave in the next six hours. Then, of the bees that went out first, the ones that haven't yet returned, come back in the next six hours.

Brittany and her mother go to the museum. Admission is $12 for adults and $10 for children. Brittany's mother paid the accountant for a ticket for each child and adult. If she received $8 in fish, how many dollars did she give the accountant?

Charlie has three times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy does. James has four times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy does. If Charlie has 12 Facebook friends, how many Facebook friends does James have?

Steve and Tim decided which of them would be the first to get home from school. Steve lives farther away than Tim, so he can ride a bike. Steve lives three miles from school, so he can cycle 440 feet in one minute. Tim lives two miles from school. If Tim can skateboard 264 feet in one minute, how long will the loser have to wait until the loser finishes the race?

Shonda decided that the children in the neighborhood could really use the bicycle air service. She decided that it would be best to charge per tire. It would cost 25 cents to inflate each tire. The first day, five people inflated both tires on a bicycle. Three people inflated all the tires on a tricycle.
Carl buys 10 packs of cookies. Each packet contains 6 cookies. Each cookie costs $0.10. If Carl pays with a $10 bill, how many fish do you get back?

Dave bought a large pack of fries and ate 14 of them before a hungry turtle snatched the pack from his hand. The turtle came down and ate half of the fries Dave had eaten. Then three pigeons snatched the food from him and each ate three of the fries. Then the aligamas took two-thirds of the remaining fries. The ants took the last fries and left five. How many fries were in the pack when Dave bought them?

On Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, college students take three one-hour classes each day. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, they take two two-hour classes each day. In one semester, school is 16 weeks. In one semester, how many hours do students attend classes?

Bill bakes 300 rolls, 120 chocolate croissants, 60 baguettes every day, each roll is four inches long, each croissant is six inches long, and each baguette is two feet long. If you line up all the things that Bill baked, how many feet would you get?

The zookeeper feeds all the monkeys in the zoo. He orders all the bananas from the local farm every two months. If a monkey needs 200 bananas, a gorilla 400 bananas, and a hippopotamus 100 bananas every month, how many bananas does he need to order in two months?

Blake and Kelly are competing to see who can run the most laps in 15 minutes. They decide to race on a 100-yard football field. Blake runs 15 laps back and forth. Kelly runs one lap back and forth, deciding she doesn't want to run next to Blake, and runs to the 40-yard line and back. She does this 34 times. How much longer did the winner run than the loser?
Rafael went out to buy school supplies. He bought four pens for $1.50 each, two bills for $4 each, and a $20 note. How much did Rafael spend in all?

Finn sees eleven octopuses swimming in a pond. Suddenly, six of them emerge from hiding under the leaves of a lotus, and two of them hide under a rock. Finn, how many octopuses do you see in the pond right now?
The water tank is 17 feet deep on Monday. Tuesday, the tank has 7 feet of water. Wednesday, the water tank is two-thirds as deep as Tuesday.

Anakin and Roxine went to the beach today. Anakin caught 10 kingfishers, 6 kingfishers, and 3 kingfishers, while Roxine caught 5 kingfishers, 3 kingfishers, and 2 kingfishers less than Anakin. How many fish did they catch?
So, if you're looking at a bag of beans, it's $20 and it goes up every two months, 20 percent of the original price.

In the room, there are various toys: five red cars, three action figures, and one doll. The dolls cost the same as three action figures, and one red car costs $4. If the action figures are $5, how much are all the toys worth?

Jackie is trying to decide whether to handle the taxes herself or hire an accountant. If she does it herself, she will lose three hours of freelance work and $35 an hour in lost income. The accountant costs $90. How much can she make if she hires an accountant?

Elvira, with many accessories, chose a new computer as her 30th birthday present. She has a budget of 1,500 euros donated by the whole family, and she thinks she can save some money on clothes. She goes to a computer shop and chooses a machine that costs 1,090 euros, including a screen, keyboard and mouse. She also buys a scanner and a CD burner for 157 euros, and a printer for 102 euros. How much clothes will she have left?

Sandra's neighbors give her a basket of nine eggs every time she takes care of their daughter. To make a Spanish fries, you need three eggs. If Sandra has a job to make 15 Spanish fries for a school fundraiser, how many times does she have to take care of the children?
And then, two years later, they're both 28 years old.
So let's say that Jimmy has $2.50 more than Ethan has.
Pancho walks 20 miles a day. He walks only on weekends, 10 miles. How many miles does he walk a week?

The marching band has ordered new uniforms: a $25 hat, a jacket that costs three times as much as the hat, and pants that cost the average price of a hat and a jacket. How much do all the uniforms cost?
Jake walks to the insect museum. He sees 80 eight-legged spiders, 90 six-legged insects, and a rare mutant invertebrate with 10 legs each. How many legs does Jake see in all?

There are four birds in a cabbage. A salsify is three years older than a grayling. A grayling is twice as old as a salsify. If a salsify is in the same year as a salsify, and a salsify is eight years old, what is the sum of the four years?

Jessica is trying to figure out how much she should pay off each month. Her student loan is at least $300 a month, her credit card is at least $200 a month, and her mortgage is at least $500 a month. If Jessica wants to pay 50% more than the minimum, how much will she pay off in a year?

Billy is peeling potatoes to prepare potato salad for a family barbecue. It's a big event, so he needs to prepare 60 potatoes. The potatoes are roughly the same size, so it takes the same amount of time to peel and cut each potato. It takes Billy a minute and a half to peel a potato, and only five seconds to cut it.

Juan and his brother Carlos sell lemonade, they consume $3 per gallon of lemon and $2 of sugar, they sell it for $0.50 per cup, and they make 20 cups per gallon. If they make $25 in profit, how much did they spend on lemon?
If there were 60 men on the Chinese team, how many women on the Chinese team?

Zayed spends a quarter of his salary on rent, a third on fuel for his car, and the other half on his favorite charity. He gives his daughter $200 for weekly expenses and his wife $700 for groceries and household items. If Zayed earns $6,000 a month, how much is left after these expenses and donations?
A queen has ten more ears than a monk, who has four fewer ears than a bo. If a bo has 40 ears, how many ears do the three of them have in total?
Lloyd is a math tutor who makes $10 an hour. He teaches five hours the first week, eight hours the next week. How much did he make the first two weeks?

In a school in Surrey, two people are running for class president. If the winner gets three-quarters of the votes, if the total number of students voting in the class was 80, count the number of votes the loser got.

The florist in the corner, Sandra, was very upset by Fred's failure to deliver her order. Sandra had ordered and ordered four times as many red roses as white carnations. She had also ordered 200 pink hollandaise cayes, five times as many as white carnations. Sandra threatened to change suppliers if she could not deliver the red roses by 5 p.m.
Jane is two years older than Mark. Two years ago, Mark was five years older than half of Jan. If Jan is 30, how old is Jane?

Two track teams are competing in a 1600 meter relay. Each team has four runners who each run 400 meters or a standard track lap. One team has equal ability, each running 400 meters in exactly 55 seconds. The other team has a slight difference in ability, the first runner runs in 60 seconds, and the next runner runs in 3 seconds faster than the runner before him. Based on this information, what is the winning team's winning margin?
Jerry is rolling a six-sided die. What is the percentage chance that he will roll a number greater than 3 than the chance that he will roll an even number twice in a row?
Jenna and her mother picked a few apples from the apple farm. Jenna picked half as many as her mother. If her mother picked 20 apples, how many apples did you and Jenna pick?

Russell works in a pet shop, and he's trying to give the rodent animals some straw. There are the same number of rats in each of the three cages, and each rat is given six straws. On the other hand, there are 10 cages with hamsters in each, and each hamster is given five straws. On the other hand, there is a rabbit hut, and 20 straws are given to the entire rabbit population.
Mandy owes Benedict $100. They agreed to pay 2% interest every month. If Mandy can pay it back in three months, how much should she pay Benedict?

If a merchant bought several sacks of wheat from a farm for $20 a sack, and it took $2 to transport the sacks of wheat from the farm to the warehouse, and if the merchant sold a sack of wheat for $30 and made $400 in profit, how many sacks of wheat did the merchant sell?

Three friends bought three tickets to a traveling amusement park for $20.25. They bought food for $4.50 less than the ticket. They got two rides on a $33-per-ride vehicle. If you divide all the expenses equally, how much did you pay per person?
John harvests peaches in three hours. He can harvest two peaches in one minute. How many peaches does he harvest?
A duck needs to eat 3.5 pounds of insects every week to survive. If you have a flock of 10 ducks, how many pounds of insects do you need per day?
Tom plants 10 trees a year. Every year he cuts down two trees a year. He starts with 50 trees. After 10 years, 30% of the trees die. How many trees does he have left?

Sue lives in a pleasant neighborhood. One weekend, her neighbors decided to make fun of her. On Friday morning, the neighbors set up 18 plastic pink flamingos in her front yard. On Saturday morning, the neighbors scraped a third of the flamingos, painted them white, and returned the newly painted white flamingos to Sue's front yard. Then, on Sunday morning, they added another 18 plastic pink flamingos to their collection.
Violet wants to buy new pencils. She needs five different colors, and I have set aside $20 for this purchase. One pencil costs $2. How much will her pencil cost?
A pencil is the same price as a pencil and eraser. A pencil is $1.20, and an eraser is $0.30. How much is eight pens?
In one town, 200 pounds of raisins are going to be distributed to 40 restaurants. Each restaurant is supposed to receive two pounds of raisins. How many pounds of raisins are left undistributed?
The city of Soda has a population of 23,786, including 8,417 men and 9,092 women. The rest of the population is children. How many children are there in Soda?

Elaine started with 20 Pokémon cards. A month later, she collected three times as many cards. The second month, she collected 20 fewer cards than the first month. The third month, she collected twice as many cards as the total number of Pokémon cards she collected in the first and second months. How many Pokémon cards does Elaine have now?

Mark is an editor. He edits the same number of sentences each week for two publishers, each paying a different amount per sentence. Publisher B pays twice as much as Publisher A. Mark edits a total of 1,000 sentences each week, and Publisher A pays him 5 cents per sentence. How many cents does Mark get each week?
A bard gets water from a well. He gets five barrels of water every morning, six barrels every afternoon. If each barrel contains five liters of water, how many liters of water does he get every day?

John received a prize for his work. This prize comes with a $5,000 stipend and a 5% raise in salary. If John earned $2,000 every week for the entire year and received this prize on the first day of the year, how much would John have received that year?
Josie grows grapes on a ten-acre farm. Each acre can produce five tons of grapes per year. Each ton of grapes can produce two barrels of wine. How many barrels of wine can her farm produce each year?

Karl's favorite food is cheese. He ate a sandwich for lunch every day this week, and he used two pieces of cheese for each sandwich. Three days of that week, he ate a cheese egg omelet for breakfast, and he used one more piece of cheese per omelet than he used for his sandwich. That week, and several days later, he continued to eat macaroni cheese from a large plate, and he used eight pieces of cheese for this one. How many pieces of cheese did he use in total?

Janet has 22 green pens, 10 yellow pens. Then she bought six bags of blue pens, and two bags of red pens. There were nine in each bag of blue pens, and six in each bag of red pens. How many pens does Janet have now?

Brinley is taking a math class with Dr. Bart. Bart takes six tests each semester. He allows students to subtract the lowest score from the average each semester. If Brinley scores 89, 71, 92, 100, and 86 on the first five tests, how many points does she need to get on the sixth test to get an average of 93?

Michael loves to ride his bike. He rides it at least five times a week, and runs 25 kilometers each time. He did it for four weeks, and then only twice a week, but he decided to ride 60 kilometers each time, and he did it for three weeks.

Joe's bag of Halloween candy contains 25 chocolate bars and 80 apple candies, each bar weighing twice as much as the apple candy. If each chocolate bar weighs 40 grams, how many grams does Joe's bag of candy weigh?

Rose went to the store on Monday and bought four cakes. On Tuesday, she went to a different store and bought three times as many cakes. On Wednesday, she went to another store and bought five times as many cakes as she had bought on Tuesday. How many cakes did she buy in three days?
Twenty dozen cups are $1,200 cheaper than the total of half a dozen plates sold for $6,000.

Sarah went to buy her new jacket and two pairs of shoes. The jacket she wanted was $30; the shoes were $20 each. Sarah made $5 each for taking care of the neighborhood children four times. Her parents gave her $4 for every time she cut the grass. If Sarah had already saved $10 before she started taking care of the children, how many times would she have to cut the grass to get the jacket and shoes?

Jerry owns a flock of chickens. The red chickens lay three eggs a day, and the white chickens lay five eggs a day. Jerry collects 42 eggs a day. If he owned two more white chickens than red chickens, how many red chickens would there be?
Gary likes to walk a rectangular, one-and-a-half-mile and six-mile stretch of the local park. If he walks three miles an hour, how many hours does he spend walking?

At the one-dollar store, Stone counted 100 customers coming in. The next day, she counted 50 more customers coming in than the first day. If the total number of customers on the third day was 500, how many customers came in on the third day?

Jerry has two pools, both with leaks, and they're leaking four gallons of water a minute. Four minutes ago, the big pool had twice the water of the small pool. Now, the big pool has four times the water of the small pool. Now, how much water does the small pool have?
Laurie wants to buy $320 shoes and a $32 belt to match them. She earns $8 an hour in a part-time job. How many hours would she have to work before she could buy a shoe?
Janes borrowed $2,000 and promised to pay it back at a 10% interest rate. If you pay $165 a month for 12 months, what is the balance of the debt after 12 months?
There are four roses in a vase. There are seven more daisies in the vase than roses. How many flowers are there in the vase?
Adrian is three times as old as Harriet, and Harriet is half as old as Zach. If Harriet is 21 now, what will the average age of the three be in three years?
In the board game, the four students scored a total of 251 points. Naomi scored 68. Yuri scored 10 more points than Naomi and Briana scored 17 more points than Naomi. How many points did JoJo score?
Carmen takes 10 minutes to solve a crossword puzzle, 5 minutes to solve a puzzle. Over the weekend, she did three crossword puzzles, and eight puzzles. How much time did she spend on these puzzles?

One tank holds 120 liters of water. Selene used 90 liters of the tank's water to water her small garden. After that, she was able to collect twice as much rainwater as she had left. How much water is in the tank?
Andy plants 90 geraniums and 40 petunias less than geraniums. How many plants does he plant in total?
A company spends $15,000 in advertising in one year, and then a third of that the next year. What is the total amount of advertising that the company has spent in two years?

Carlos and Benji are on the beach. Carlos rented a canoe for $30 an hour, Benji rented a banana boat for $18 an hour. If Carlos uses the canoe for three hours and Benji uses the boat for five hours, how much rent will they pay in total?

Andrew plans to travel by car from New Jersey to Rochester, which would take six days by bus and half as many by car. How many days would it take to travel by bus to Rochester and then drive back to New Jersey?

James is counting the Pokémon cards. He has 30 fire types, 20 grass types, and 40 water types. If he loses 8 water types and buys 14 grass types, what is the probability that the randomly chosen card will be a water type (four tosses to the nearest decimal point)?

Chad ordered a homemade brito for lunch. The basic brito is $6.50. He orders an extra meat for $2.00, an extra cheese for $1.00, an extra avocado for $1.00, two $0.25 sauces. He paid an extra $3.00 for lunch, upgraded, added potato chips and drinks. He has a $5.00 gift card to use at the accounting office. How much is his bill now?
Kalinda is working on a 360-piece puzzle with her mother. Kalinda can sew four pieces per minute. Her mother can sew half as many as Kalinda. How long does it take to complete this puzzle?

One nut farm had grown 120 small nut trees. When Ashlyn visited the farm two months later, she took home 30 percent of the nut trees that were ready to be harvested. When she returned two weeks later, she harvested three-quarters of the remaining nut trees that were ready to be harvested. How many of the nut trees were not ready to be harvested?
Mark bought 12 cars for his company. Each car cost $20,000. Mark paid 10% of the car's tax and $1,000 for each car to register. How much did he pay in total?

Kylie and Robert love to collect shells on the beach. On Monday, Kylie collected five more shells than Robert, and Robert collected 20 shells. On Tuesday, Kylie collected twice as many shells as on Monday. How many shells did Kylie collect on Tuesday?
Dax went to the field to pick apples and found that the number of insects in the garden was half that of the ants. If there were 50 ants, how many insects would there be in the field altogether?
Thirty-six penguins are sunbathing in the snow. One third of them start swimming in the water. The other third go into the cave to eat. How many penguins are still sunbathing?

Steve decided to eat more tomatoes and started growing his own cherry tomatoes. He eats twice as many tomatoes as his girlfriend. He eats six tomatoes a day. If he could make three tomatoes a week from one tomato, how many tomatoes would Steve need?

John ordered a pizza with his friends. We want to have a total of 20 friends, so that each of them can eat four slices. The slice of pizza is eight slices per slice. How many slices of pizza does John need to order?
So, if you buy 25 pens and when you run out of ink, you collect them and make them into one pen, how many pens can you use in total?
So, if you're going to be a millionaire, you're going to be a millionaire, and if you're going to be a millionaire, you're going to be a millionaire.
Mary is two years younger than John, and John is five years older than Jesse. If Jesse is twenty, what is the sum of their ages?

There were 1,000 students in a classroom. There were three entrances A, B, and C. If 30% of the students left from exit A, and three-fifths of the students left from exit B, and the rest of the students left from exit C, how many students left from exit C?
James has six more candies than Robert. John has twice as many candies as Robert. If John has 54 candies, how many more candies does John have than James?
Dolly has two books. Pandora has one. If Dolly and Pandora have read each other's books in addition to their own, how many books have they read in total?

Mike has five correspondents. He has stopped corresponding with two of them. Each of them sends five letters twice a week. Mike replies with the same content. Mike can write in six minutes per letter. How many hours a week do you spend writing letters?

Jason has a contract plan that allows him to make 1,000 phone calls a month. He calls his boss for 15 minutes a day, and he called everyone else for 300 minutes this month. If this month is the month that ends on the 30th, how many more minutes can he make this month?

Griffin had 24 fries, but Kyle took five of them. Billy took twice as many as Kyle. Ginger gave Griffin several, but Colby took three fewer fries from Griffin than Kyle. If Griffin ended up with 27 fries, how many did Ginger give Griffin?

There are four snails in one aquarium, and 32 snails in another. The difference is twice the total number of fish in both aquariums. If there are the same number of fish in each aquarium, how many fish are there in each aquarium?

Jean is charged $250 an hour by a makeup artist. The film she is in requires expensive makeup, six hours of makeup each time, and four times a week. The film was completed in five weeks. After the film was completed, the makeup artist gave Jean a 10% discount because it was a large payment.

Isabel bought party supplies for her sister's birthday party. She spent $12 on cake ingredients, $43 on birthday gifts, $15 on decorations, $4 on invitation cards, and $22 on gift bags for guests attending the party. She divided the cost equally between her parents and herself. How much did each of them pay?
The chef bought four bags of onions. Each one weighs 50 pounds. One pound of onions costs $1.50. How much did the chef spend?

On Monday, Sue ate the same amount of cookies as her sister. On Tuesday, she ate twice as many cookies as her sister. She ate five cookies on Monday, and then 13 cookies the next day. If one cookie has 200 calories, how many calories did Sue get compared to her sister?
